subject: Baseball
Athletics and Sports
lead_paragraph: Major League Baseball eliminated a 24-hour notice of drug testing and imposed background checks on clubhouse personnel, adopting recommendations in the Mitchell report on drugs in the sport. A statement from Commissioner Bud Selig also said clubhouse personnel would be subject to random drug tests and teams would be required to log all packages sent to major league clubhouses. Personal trainers were banned from locker rooms.
